title: WHO IS OP?

embed.description: Yo guys Markhear back with a brand new series! This series will focus on all the new and upcoming OP champions during each patch. I hope to make this series one of the regular uploads I put onto this channel and I hope you all enjoy. Without further ado enjoy.

replies.body: inb4 people whine about kalista's passive
do you remember the days when kiting took a little bit of skill... pepperidge farm remembers

Implying Kalista's passive isn't a problem.

Edit: I would have rather not nerfed her backwards leap distance instead take out the slow from Rend. It's not needed after a sizeable amount of attack speed with Kalista.
That sounds like a great idea actually! I just had a hyper carry kalista and she does seem pretty strong right now given her difficulty however I feel it is appropriate.

Inb4 people whine about Darius.

Every game i play with him I can carry hard. And then they whine about how darius is OP. It's like people don't realize the recall button exists and potions/sustain are a thing
I think it's more that if you even feed him one kill he then two shots you and remains tanky, basically a more efficient riven.

He's a lane bully. He's designed to snowball HARD in lane. Survive his awesome early game, and you can ride out a fairly easy game as he's very immobile and requires flash to do anything if you zone right.
I enjoy versing him on singed because I feel like it's a skill match-up but pretty much any champ without an escape or mobility are countered especially when you call the jungler.

Cho'gath, tons of sustain, kill potential both pre and post-6, a smite that can be used on champions, AoE knock-up and slow, 2.5 second AoE silence, free health and waveclear, and people say pre-nerf Gragas had an overloaded kit, well, he did but Cho'Gath is still pretty damn scary.
OH YES! I played him a lot back in patch 5.11, can't believe I forgot about him. Thanks!
